headline: Charles Schwab & American Express earnings, Hertz stock jumps
summary: Stocks (^GSPC, ^IXIC) wavered into the weekend, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) slipping as UnitedHealth (UNH) dragged on the index. Charles Schwab (SCHW) shares rose after the company posted record first quarter revenue. American Express (AXP) topped earnings estimates but reported higher-than-expected expenses. Hertz (HTZ) extended gains on news of a major investment from Bill Ackman's investment firm Pershing Square. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: AmEx profit beats expectations on steady card spending
summary: (Reuters) -American Express beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Thursday as its affluent customers shrugged off fears of a slowdown to continue spending on travel and entertainment.  The credit card giant also stuck to its profit and revenue forecast for 2025, at a time when several businesses have withdrawn guidance citing the uncertainty surrounding the new U.S. administration's trade policies.  AmEx sees revenue growing at an 8% to 10% range in 2025, while profit is expected to be between $15 and $15.50 per share.

raw.headline: AmEx profit beats expectations on steady card spending
raw.summary: (Reuters) -American Express beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Thursday as its affluent customers shrugged off fears of a slowdown to continue spending on travel and entertainment.  The credit card giant also stuck to its profit and revenue forecast for 2025, at a time when several businesses have withdrawn guidance citing the uncertainty surrounding the new U.S. administration's trade policies.  AmEx sees revenue growing at an 8% to 10% range in 2025, while profit is expected to be between $15 and $15.50 per share.

headline: American Express: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: NEW YORK (AP) — American Express Co. (AXP) on Thursday reported first-quarter earnings of $2.58 billion. The New York-based company said it had profit of $3.64 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

headline: American Express Delivers Strong First-Quarter Results With Revenue of $17.0 Billion, up 7%, or 8% on an FX-Adjusted Basis
summary: NEW YORK, April 17, 2025--American Express Company (NYSE: AXP) today reported first-quarter net income of $2.6 billion, or $3.64 per share, compared with net income of $2.4 billion, or $3.33 per share, a year ago.
